Name: Stela of Ramesses the Second
Description: The scene depicted on the stela shows king Ramesses the second wearing the blue crown (Khepresh) of the ceremonies.  He is burning insence and pouring libations infront of the god Menevis "Men - wer / wnn - nefer" on the occasion of dedicating a great stela of white limestone to the god.  The text also includes the names and epithets of the King.
